question: Consider the linear operator $F:\mathbb{R}^2 \longrightarrow \mathbb{R}^2$ such that $F(x,y)=(x+2y,2x+3y)$. Choose the right answer:
answer1: $F^{-1}$ is a symmetric operator defined by $F^{-1}(x,y)=(-3x+2y, 2x-y)$
answer3: $F^{-1}$ is defined by $F^{-1}(x,y)=(3x-2y, -2x+y)$ and is not a symmetric operator
answer4: $F^{-1}$ is a symmetric operator defined by $F^{-1}(x,y)=(3x-2y, 2x-y)$

question: The set of complex numbers that satisfy the condition Im$(z)>0$ is the

The conjunction of equations $\dfrac{2x-1}{3}=2-y=\dfrac{z+3}{2}$ determine a straight line $r$. 
Choose the right answer:
answer1: $r$ has the direction of $v=\bigg(\dfrac{3}{2}, -1, 2\bigg)$ and contains the point $P=\bigg(\dfrac{1}{2}, 2, -3\bigg)$.
answer2: $r$ has the direction of $v=(3, 1, 2)$ and contains the point $P=(1, 2, -3)$.
answer3: $r$ has the direction of $v=\bigg(\dfrac{3}{2}, 1, 2\bigg)$ and contains the point $P=\bigg(\dfrac{1}{2}, 2, -3\bigg)$.
answer4: $r$ has the direction of $v=(3, -1, 2)$ and contains the point $P=(1, 2, -3)$.

question: Choose the true statement.
answer1: If $T$ is an equilateral triangle, then $T$ is an acute triangle.
answer2: If $T$ is an acute triangle, then $T$ is an equilateral triangle.
answer3: If $T$ is a right triangle, then $T$ is a scalene triangle.
answer4: If $T$ is an obtuse triangle, then $T$ is an isosceles triangle.

question: Consider the linear operator $F:\mathbb{R}^2 \longrightarrow \mathbb{R}^2$ such that $F(x,y)=(x+2y,2x+3y)$. Choose the right answer:
answer1: $F^{-1}$ is a symmetric operator defined by $F^{-1}(x,y)=(-3x+2y, 2x-y)$
answer3: $F^{-1}$ is defined by $F^{-1}(x,y)=(3x-2y, -2x+y)$ and is not a symmetric operator
answer4: $F^{-1}$ is a symmetric operator defined by $F^{-1}(x,y)=(3x-2y, 2x-y)$

question:
Let $H=\left\{\left[\begin{array}{rr}
      a & b \\
	 0 & a^2
			\end{array}\right]: a,b \in \mathbb{R}\right\}$. Choose the right answer.
answer1:
$H$ is not a subspace of $M_{2\times 2}(\mathbb{R})$ because $\left[\begin{array}{rr}
      3 & 2 \\
	 0 & 9
			\end{array}\right] + \left[\begin{array}{rr}
      1 & 0 \\
	 0 & 1
			\end{array}\right] \notin H$
answer2:
$H$ is a subspace of $M_{2\times 2}(\mathbb{R})$ because $\left[\begin{array}{rr}
      0 & 0 \\
	 0 & 0
			\end{array}\right] \in H$
answer3:
Since $ 1\times\left[\begin{array}{rr}
      a & b \\
	 0 & a^2
			\end{array}\right] \in H$, than $H$ is a subspace of $M_{2\times 2}(\mathbb{R})$
answer4:
$H$ is not a  subspace of $M_{2\times 2}(\mathbb{R})$ because $\left[\begin{array}{rr}
      2 & 0 \\
	 0 & 6
			\end{array}\right] + \left[\begin{array}{rr}
      1 & 0 \\
	 0 & 1
			\end{array}\right] \notin H$

question: Find  $\displaystyle\int_{0}^{2}\int_{x}^{x^2} y^2x \, dy dx$.

Solve the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
x & + & 2y & - & 3z & + & w & = & -2 \\
3x & - & y & - & 2z & - & 4w & = & 1 \\
2x & + & 3y & - & 5z & + & w & = & -3 \\
x & + & y & - & z & + & w & = & -2
\end{cases}$$
answer2: The system has $\left(z+w,\,z-w-1,\,z,\,w\right)$ as solution for all $z,w\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer3: The system has $\left(1,\,2,\,2,\,1\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer4: The system has $\left(x,\,y,\,x+y,\,x-y-1\right)$ as solution for all $x,y\in\mathbb{R}$.

Consider the line $r$ which is the intersection of the planes $\pi_1: x-2y+z=1$ and $\pi_2: 2x+3y-z=0$. Choose the right answer.
answer1: The line $r$ has the direction of the vector $w=(1, -3, -7)$.
answer2: The line $r$ has the direction of the vector $v=(1, 3, -1)$.
answer3: The line $r$ is perpendicular with $v=(1, -2, 1)$ and is collinear with $u=(2, 3, -1)$.
answer4: The line $r$ is collinear with the vectors $v=(1, -2, 1)$ and $u=(2, 3, -1)$.

answer1: $(1,1)$ is a minimum and $(0,0)$ is a saddle point.
answer2: $(1,1)$ is a saddle point and $(0,0)$ is a minimum.
answer3: $(1,1)$ and $(-1,-1)$ are a saddle points and $(0,0)$ is a minimum.

answer1: There are $1$ local maximum and $1$ saddle point.

question:

$$\begin{array}{c|ccc}
x & 2 & 2.5 & 4   \\
\hline
y & 0.5 & 0.4 & 0.25 \\
\end{array}$$

Find the Lagrange's polynomial.

Solve the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
x & + & 3y & - & z & + & w & = & -2 \\
3x & - & y & - & 3z & - & 4w & = & 1 \\
2x & + & 3y & - & 5z & + & w & = & -3
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The solutions of the system are of the form $\bigg(\frac{22w+7}{15},\,\frac{-7w-7}{10},\,\frac{11w+11}{30}\bigg)$ for every $w\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer3: The system has $\left(1,\,2,\,6,\,-2\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer4: The system has $\left(3w,\,w-1,\,2w,\,w\right)$ as solution for every $w\in\mathbb{R}$.
